Okay, can we desist from this immature mudslinging? I have no
emotional tie=
s to JUnit and TDD although I use it as far as possible
to write better cod=
e - but if there's a complementary paradigm that
can help the code be bette=
r, I'd like to hear about it; There are
some people who are constructively =
debating with "javainsel" and I'd
like to hear that, without this kind of i=
nane background noise.
If this does turn out to be an April fool's joke, I'=
ve been truly had.
but DbC and JTest sound interesting to me.
regards,
Nile=
